page.title: 07HIGH HURSTWOOD FARM PEOPLE
page.content: There are 9 farmers and 10 employed workers, including 2 managers. 6 wives or daughters help part-time. 8 full- time workers are employed to look after horses, casual labour is also used. Wages at age 20 or over are Â£89.70 basic, Â£103.16 for craftsmen. There are 7 tied cottages. The Farm Contractor, hiring out large equip- ment is vital to the modern farmer. Although most farmers would not want any other way of life they are pessimistic about the future. They accept the long hours and continual battle with the weather (particularly bad in 1985) but feel "squeezed" by the Common Market and report that income is far down on lO - l5 years ago. It is a case of survival of the fittest.
